Description:
Ballistics of the 3UBM1 110x910mmR APFSDS round with the 3BM1 penetrator, of Tungsten-Carbide tipped construction, fired from the T-12 and MT-12 anti-tank guns. Entered service in the early 1960s. The ballistcs is identical as the 3UBM2 APFSDS with 3BM2 steel penetrator.

Loads 6.6 kg of 15/1 DG-4 grains with 0.25 kg of ignition charge and flame suppressant. Breech pressure is specified at 3,350 kgf/cm² and converted from copper crusher gauge with a factor of 1.12 x 0.098 = 367.7 MPa. Projectile travel estimated from a gun length of 6300 mm (63 calibers), chamber length 915 mm. Tabulated velocity is 1575 m/s.

References:
- 100-мм ПРОТИВОТАНКОВАЯ ПУШКА MT-12 РУКОВОДСТВО СЛУЖБЫ (1980)
- артиллерийские метательные заряды (Г.Г. Валеев, В.Ф. Сопин, Б.А. Соков, 2004)
